newsitem.title: USA: Capital gains poor way to raise funds - Greenspan.
newsitem.headline: Capital gains poor way to raise funds - Greenspan.

text.p: Federal Reserve Board Chairman Alan Greenspan on Thursday said that the capital gains tax was a poor way for the government to raise revenues.
In testimony before the Senate Finance Committee, Greenspan said that, at a mimimum, capital gains should be indexed for inflation.

"If the rate of inflation overall is rising, and that clearly has an impact on the assets that were involved in the capital gains tax, then at a mimimum I believe we should strip (that) out of the base of that tax," he said.
